name: Chow Mein
instructions: Boil chicken meat in water (about a half pan of water).
When chicken is done remove from pan.
When cool, take meat off bones.
I usually do this the day before so that I can refrigerate the broth and remove the hardened fat the next day.
Add 1-2 onions, celery and cook for 10 minutes after boiling.
Add water chestnuts, mushrooms with liquid.
Thickening: mix 1 cups cornstarch, 1 Tbsp sugar, water, soy sauce.
Mix to get smooth, then add more soy sauce if needed so that the color is slightly darker than a lunch bag.
Slowly add to stock and stir, I usually add 1/2 - 3/4 of entire thickening.
Stir, and boil a few minutes, add more thickening if necessary.
Turn off and let season or add chicken and stir, serve.
I usually let it season for a while then reheat and add chicken and serve.
